name: Protea Hotel Victoria Junction

reviews.text: I travel often and found this hotel to be one of the best regarding service. Everyone on staff went overboard to help. The service at breakfast is fantastic, and there is a vast selection of food offered. I was in awe when I walked down the stairs from the first floor to the breakfast room to see a view that was like no other. I could have stayed in a single spot all day. I am eager to return to Capetown and when I do, I plan to stay in this hotel. Proteas overall are a fantastic chain!
reviews.title: Clean, Fantastic Service and Magnificent View

reviews.text: Very comfortable stay, rooms are spacious, breakfast is good. Staff is amazing. Great service. Location is superb. 10 min walk from waterfront.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and service

reviews.text: I rate very highly this recently upgraded hotel. The staff were helpful , attentive and they were determined to make the stay an enjoyable one. The rooms were spacious and clean and the room safe was an added bonus. Breakfasts were were excellent and the a la carte meals were of a high standard. Nothing was too much trouble. Most people tried the local restaurants. The restaurant had a little bit of a canteen feel - but do not let that fool you as the food is top quality. The Hotel is 15 minutes good walk to the Cape Town Waterfront. Taxis cost about 40 -50 Rand. Make sure you take a metered taxi - there unregistered taxis claiming to be the hotel shuttle. Ignor them as they overcharge.
reviews.title: A Recommended Stop

reviews.text: I think everyone was delighted with the hotel
reviews.title: Good price quality accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First rate rooms if somewhat masculine style but good facilities with nice restaurant facilities, staff very friendly. Close enough to walk to city and or Victoria and Alfred docks.
reviews.title: Newly refurbished hotel offers great value!

reviews.text: The hotel re-opened at the beginning of the September and looks great. Our bedroom overlooking the football stadium was large, spotless and had a flatscreen tv with all the sports channels - there were a couple of teething problems, leaking shower and safe which hadn't been wired up. Breakfast was excellent with a huge choice and a large vegetarian section. The hotel is within easy reach of the V&A waterfront and the city centre. We were advised to book a taxi to travel after dark which we did - to be fair we were pestered by beggars during the day when out walking - but, this is my only gripe with the hotel, the 'taxi' would arrive immediately - impressive until you realised it was one of the hotel staff's limos and you were then charged 40 rands for the first passenger and 20 each for the rest of the group, making a short journey for four 100 rand(dearer than London?)
reviews.title: Contemporary Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had just been open 1 day after extensive renovation and in my opinion still had to find its heart and soul. I cannot fault the rooms - they were urban and hip with desk, ipod dock, flatscreen tv, tea/coffee making facilities, perfect lighting etc. The restuarant lacked atmosphere but was excellent value and the food tasted lovely.
reviews.title: Awesome, newly renovated, contemporary hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights in the most gorgeous loft room in Victoria Junction. It was very unique with the living area being on the lower level with steps leading up to the Mezannine bedroom. Any hitches from the renovation had been sorted out and we had no complaints whatsoever. Loved the Nespresso machine in the room! Staff were great and breakfasts left nothing to be desired. We ate in the restaurant one night. The menu is brief but it does cover all tastes and was delicious.
reviews.title: Fantastic loft rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will have no problem in recommending Victoria Junnction and will certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I would really recommend this hotel. The rooms were modern well appointed and to a very good standard. Service was great with all staff being helpful and welcoming. Breakfasts were everything you could wish for with a very good selection both hot and cold. The location was ideal as it was walking distance to the waterfront (recommend the use of a taxi after dusk which would cost only R40) We stayed for three nights would certainly stay here again when visiting Cape Town
reviews.title: Good location - beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought this Protea was a fabulous place to stay. The hotel is walking distance from the waterfront (although we were told to take a cab in the evenings. The rooms are not very large, but were very clean and modern. The chocolate that was left by our pillow was delicious and the staff was extremely helpful. The breakfast offered was a buffet with a lot of variety. I think the Protea chain is a safe bet throughout South Africa.
reviews.title: Vic Junction is at the center of it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Protea Victoria Junction was part of a Gate1 Travel tour. The hotel room was large, very comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet would satisfy anyone, with the cook staff preparing eggs & omelets, large selection of hot items, fruits and continental bread, cheese and cold cut selections. The employees of this hotel are friendly, helpful and skilled. The location is within walking distance of the Waterfront, which has become the center of Cape Town's shopping and restaurant venues.
reviews.title: Like the atmosphere and location

description: Situated in the urban landscape of Greenpoint, one of Cape Town’s trendiest suburbs, The Protea Hotel Victoria Junction’s location offers easy access to major Cape Town tourist attractions as well as the CBD, the Cape Town International Convention Centre and the V&A Waterfront for GUESTS staying on business. Our in house, Connexxion Restaurant is the perfect option for guests on the go. The breakfast buffet remains of international standard with a huge variety of items to choose from and for your convenience – breakfast hours over weekends are extended so you can sleep in! The Hotel provides a new contemporary urban lifestyle where you can live, work and play within a 5 kilometre radius. Walk to the Cape Quarter Lifestyle Centre and the Greenpoint Park or cycle on the new pedestrian and cycle ways. Catch a MyCity bus or the red Cape Town Tourism bus to visit Clifton, Camps Bay beach or as far as Simon’s Town and Constantia! All the bedrooms feature sleek, modern design that offer environmentally friendly lighting, water-saving rain showers and energy efficient entertainment options like the Bravia LCD screens and iPod docking stations. International adapter installations also improve services to our International GUESTS. Protea Hotel Victoria Junction - a contemporary urban lifestyle!
